data.title: do not show stackframe line information if source is missing
Question: is it possible to launch debugger from extension ?
data.body:
Hello,

I can't find an example on how to launch the debugger using the name in configuration.
Is it possible to achieve this ? If so, could you write a little snippet.

Thanks in advance for your help.

data.title: Smooth scrolling
data.body:
The scrolling behavior is not smooth when you do it with the mouse wheel. It has been fixed in chromium 49 that comes since electron 0.37.x
So, could you update to the last version of electron?
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

I left a [video](https://youtu.be/N8GcV3K6EP0) showing the difference with electron 0.37.x

data.title: [Extension list] Readme control's left border is not displaying when "development tool" is showing up with editor at certain position.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open developer tool from Help->"Toggle Developer Tools".
2. Click on extension icon from status bar and select any options to get extension list.
3. Verify "Readme" button left border.
   Note: To repro this issue adjust the developer tool display area.

Actual: Readme control border is not visible.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13979674/44917fea-f097-11e5-918c-4ce571fdcfb8.png)

data.title: Fixes --locale switch incorrect for Simplified Chinese, should be zh-cn not zh-ch
[ts lint] unable to find module references in TS project.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create "Started Node.js Express3" Type script project from Visual studio and build it.
2. Launch VS code and open the same folder to get node.js TS project.
3. Verify app.ts, express.d.ts and other files under script folder.

Actual: TS lint is highlighted red with message "Cannot find the module".
Expected: TS lint should find the references of modules and  should not flag red and green.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13979299/b7f1c060-f094-11e5-9153-d76349766e7f.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13979309/cd7e5614-f094-11e5-82ad-8e1d6d357e5b.png)

Note: I tied with C# class library project and reference to the function from one namespace to other under different projects are working fine and no error message.

data.title: Finalize default jsconfig.json
data.body:
- remove the `module` attribute?
- add the target `es6` attribute?

data.title: Curly braces in string literal in function call causes wrong syntax highlinting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Enter function call `fn("{};");` anywhere in a C++ file
2. Syntax higlighting for the rest of the file gets confused - the string is not ended correctly

However string literal in an expression works fine, e.g. `a = "{}";`

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/996834/13977709/9d06a9d2-f0cb-11e5-846f-d909eb02fffb.png)

data.title: Fixed wrong values in german translation
data.body:
In the about Dialog (Help -> Info) Node.js is literally translated to "knot".
In the menu Translation for "Open recent", the sentence is translated literally which causes that the word for "files" is missing.

data.title: [Debug]Error pop-up should go away once user fix all the errors and started debugging.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open a folder for "Blank Node.js TypeScript" project.
2. Click on debug icon from the view bar and set node debugger.
3. It will generate a launch.json file with some default settings.
4. Try to debug and verify error messages.
   5 try to generate few more errors by updating invalid entries in launch.json.
5. Now fix all the error by updating launch.json and start debugging.
6. Verify command prompt and make sure it should not generate any error message.

Actual: 
Error message pop-up remains forever and user needs to click on close button to get rid from error popup. 

Debugger started and command prompt displaying message like below with error pop-up.
node --debug-brk=29322 --nolazy BlankNodeJSTypeScriptApp\server.js 
Debugger listening on port 29322

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13976372/8580fa5a-f07c-11e5-8639-4836677e1352.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13976224/175dbc9e-f07b-11e5-9f05-c8a559e3e6f6.png)

 Debug control action hidden behind the error pop-up.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13976214/d9e005fc-f07a-11e5-9e09-37c8ef56ed00.png)

Expected: Once user fixed the errors and start debugging then error pop-up should not be displayed.

data.title: --locale command line switch as no effect if there is already a running VS Code instance
data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.12 alpha
- OS Version:Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. in one folder: code-alpha .           to start an English instance
2. in another folder: code-alpha . --locale=fr

The new instance is also in English.
1. Shutdown first code-alpha instance.  
2. code-alpha . --locale=fr 

Now VS Code comes up in french.

data.body:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. click on any file in the explorer
2. view jumps to line 10 or 12

Expected functionality would be that the file opens with line 1 visible.

data.title: Repeated module.exports expressions are erroneously flagged as problematic
data.body:
- VSCode Version: (0.10.11) f291f4ad600767626b24a4b15816b04bee9a3049
- OS Version: OS X 10.10.5

Steps to Reproduce:

![js snippet](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/829827/13972386/aca5a152-f06e-11e5-84b8-dde7bfefcff6.png)

This code is perfectly fine, and should not be flagged as an error. The error message is:

data.title: [TS] 'require' function should be highlighted same as reserved keywords as it is provided by CommonJS compliant system.
Should --locale command line setting override locale.json?
data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.12 alpha
- OS Version:Windows 8

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set a locale in locale.json e.g. `fr`
2. Launch VS Code specifying a different locale code-alpha --locale=de

I would expect the command line argument to win and override the user setting.

data.title: [TS]Getting duplicate error message in editor without adding linter extension for typescript.
data.body:
OS Version: Windows10
VSCode version: 0.10.12-alpha

Steps:
1. launch app and open a folder which contain .TS file.
2. Verify any error message is showing up.

Expected: If there is not extensions installed for TS lint then error should not be highlighted in editor.

Actual:
While verifying bug #4107 with "Express Node.js typescript" project. I observed that there are two error messages showing up in my .ts file and when I closely watched, I found there is no extension installed for TS lint. I also removed extension for ESlint as well and restarted app.

I observer that still it is showing two errors messages in the editor and when I hover over on it, it is displaying : 
1. [ts] cannot find module 'http'
2. [ts] Cannot find name process.

But when I clicked on error icon from the status bar then could see in the pop-up (in command palette) it is showing up duplicate error message like below.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13971529/2f31fdd0-f04e-11e5-8f07-09289b9c3997.png)

Questions:
1. When there is no linter installed for TS or ES then why it is displaying red mark in the code.
2. Is there any reference left for the TSLint in the system after removing extension which is causing this issue.
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13971525/22ca61b8-f04e-11e5-9c5e-c2bb0e4efce8.png)

I also verified in the extension directory and didn't find any reference of TS or ES lint extension.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13971518/1508270e-f04e-11e5-80ed-cfda052d5f96.png)

data.title: adding telemetry to extension widget
--locale switch incorrect for Simplified Chinese, should be zh-cn not zh-ch
data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.12 alpha
- OS Version:Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Try code-alpha --locale zh-cn
2. VS Code will not launch.  Doesn't not even fallback to English.

Looks like due to commit https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/42d87350424917e56b62af0a2b0ddea8fba3944a

data.title: Tabbing after a PHP variable turns the var into <1var></var>
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 Pro x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Write $variable_name
2. Press the TAB key
3. Instead of tabbing, it turns the variable into <1variable_name></variable_name>

Super frustrating as I often tab after variable names for ease of reading (when there are a list of variables)

data.title: Add to Watch allows the same variable more than once
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start debugging a Node.js project
2. Right click on any variable -> Add to Watch
3. Repeat step 2 on the same variable

Actual:
The same variable is added to the watch list as many times as you want

Expected:
It is only added to watch once

data.title: Renaming files that was moved by drag-and-drop makes the sidebar grey
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Move a file to another folder using drag and drop
2. Hit enter to rename the file that you just moved
3. Rename the file and hit enter

File names in the file browser in sidebar becomes all grey

Video: https://gfycat.com/RemorsefulMixedIchneumonfly

Edit: updated video

data.title: Fixes Read VSCODE_NLS_CONFIG form userEnv as realy as possible
Read VSCODE_NLS_CONFIG form userEnv as early as possible
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Linux

To have correct locale information we need to read the VSCODE_NLS_CONFIG from the userEnv as early as possible (e.g in index.html)

data.title: Files pane remains darkened after rename, enter key
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Right-click a file (or folder)
2. Select rename
3. Change the name of the file (I just added a prefix)
4. Press 'Enter'

Notice that the file is renamed successfully, but the files pane remains in the darkened state:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2192439/13966624/fe0e124e-f038-11e5-8287-d2223472838f.png)

Workaround:
- To restore the files pane colorization, repeat steps 1) and 2), but then just click out.

Notes:
- The files pane is still usable, just in the darkened display state.
- If you mouse-click-out of the rename input (as opposed to pressing Enter), the bug is avoided.
- If you don't actually change the file name, and press Enter, the bug is avoided.

data.title: `var` is highlighted too aggressively
data.body:
- VSCode Version: (0.10.11) f291f4ad600767626b24a4b15816b04bee9a3049
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.10.5 (14F1605)

![js snippet](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/829827/13966482/fa497a58-f048-11e5-96bf-b6364f28cc80.png)

The first `var` is highlighted as I expect. But those letters should not be highlighted in a name like `variableTimeMs`.

Thanks!

data.title: Please make the debug toolbar moveable.
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1110944/13966295/e6fd1a6e-f02e-11e5-887c-971abd7bbd41.png)
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: mac

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start debugging something
2. Try to read the filename that the debug toolbar is covering up
3. Try to move the toolbar
4. Hold your temper in when you accidentally stop your debugging process

Expected: some gripper that lets me move it to the side so i can see the filename
Resulted: can't move, even it were just positioned to the far right, then at least i could see the filename it's currently covering up.

data.title: Help > View License not redirecting properly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Help -> View License

Actual:
Redirects to http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/

Expected:
Redirect to https://code.visualstudio.com/license#vscode
